result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Anthony Joseph Lutz Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate.
Defendant shall be employed fulltime, enrolled in school fulltime or a combination of both.
Expungement granted under 973.015 after successful completion of probation without any violations.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jesse Anthony Joseph Lutz Jr in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Jesse Anthony Joseph Lutz Jr. State moves to amend charge to 346.04(2t). State will recommend 1 year probation with the following conditions: to participate in counseling deemed appropriate by DOC, to work full time or be in school full time or a combination of both, court costs, and expungement. Court grants amendment. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads guilty to charges. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. 22TR640 and 22TR641 are dismissed per agreement. State heard. Attorney Michelson heard. Defendant does not wish to be heard. Court heard and orders 1 year probation with the following conditions: to have such assessment, treatment, counseling, and programming that DOC deems appropriate, to be employed fulltime, enrolled in school fulltime, or a combination of both, to submit a DNA sample, and expungement upon successful completion of probation. Court waives court costs.
Status conference on August 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jesse Anthony Joseph Lutz Jr in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Jesse Anthony Joseph Lutz Jr. Attorney Mickelson heard on status of case and requests a continuance. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
